quotes.text: To fall in love with God is the greatest romance; to seek him the greatest adventure; to find him, the greatest human achievement.
quotes.author: St. Augustine of Hippo

quotes.text: The measure of love is to love without measure.
quotes.author: St. Augustine of Hippo

quotes.text: Fill yourself first and then only will you be able to give to others.
quotes.author: St. Augustine of Hippo

quotes.text: What does love look like? It has the hands to help others. It has the feet to hasten to the poor and needy. It has eyes to see misery and want. It has the ears to hear the sighs and sorrows of men. That is what love looks like.
quotes.author: St. Augustine of Hippo

quotes.text: Faith is to believe what you do not see; the reward of this faith is to see what you believe.
quotes.author: St. Augustine of Hippo

quotes.text: To sing is to pray twice.
quotes.author: St. Augustine of Hippo

quotes.text: The truth is like a lion; you don't have to defend it. Let it loose; it will defend itself.
quotes.author: St. Augustine of Hippo

quotes.text: Since love grows within you, so beauty grows. For love is the beauty of the soul.
quotes.author: St. Augustine of Hippo

quotes.text: Patience is the companion of wisdom.
quotes.author: St. Augustine of Hippo

quotes.text: Our hearts are made for You, O Lord, and they are restless until they rest in You.
quotes.author: St. Augustine of Hippo

quotes.text: Give me chastity and continence, but not yet.
quotes.author: St. Augustine of Hippo

quotes.text: It is love alone that gives worth to all things
quotes.author: St. Teresa of Avila

quotes.text: Patience obtains everything. Whoever has God lacks nothing; God alone suffices.
quotes.author: St. Teresa of Avila

quotes.text: The feeling remains that God is on the journey, too.
quotes.author: St. Teresa of Avila

quotes.text: There are more tears shed over answered prayers than over unanswered prayers.
quotes.author: St. Teresa of Avila

quotes.text: Mental prayer is nothing else than an intimate sharing between friends; it means taking time frequently to be alone with Him who we know loves us.
quotes.author: St. Teresa of Avila

quotes.text: Be gentle to all and stern with yourself.
quotes.author: St. Teresa of Avila

quotes.text: We can only learn to know ourselves and do what we can - namely, surrender our will and fulfill God's will in us.
quotes.author: St. Teresa of Avila

quotes.text: The Lord walks among the pots and pans.
quotes.author: St. Teresa of Avila

quotes.text: To have courage for whatever comes in life - everything lies in that.
quotes.author: St. Teresa of Avila

quotes.text: We always find that those who walked closest to Christ were those who had to bear the greatest trials.
quotes.author: St. Teresa of Avila

quotes.text: Prayer is an act of love; words are not needed. Even if sickness distracts from thoughts, all that is needed is the will to love.
quotes.author: St. Teresa of Avila

quotes.text: Accustom yourself continually to make many acts of love, for they enkindle and melt the soul.
quotes.author: St. Teresa of Avila

quotes.text: Remember that you have only one soul; that you have only one death to die; that you have only one life. If you do this, there will be many things about which you care nothing.
quotes.author: St. Teresa of Avila

quotes.text: Half an hour's meditation each day is essential, except when you are busy. Then a full hour is needed.
quotes.author: St. Francis de Sales

quotes.text: Do not wish to be anything but what you are, and try to be that perfectly.
quotes.author: St. Francis de Sales

quotes.text: Be who you are and be that well.
quotes.author: St. Francis de Sales

quotes.text: Do not lose your inner peace for anything whatsoever, even if your whole world seems upset.
quotes.author: St. Francis de Sales

quotes.text: Never be in a hurry; do everything quietly and in a calm spirit.
quotes.author: St. Francis de Sales

quotes.text: Be at peace, and put aside all anxious thoughts and imaginings.
quotes.author: St. Francis de Sales

quotes.text: A single sunbeam is enough to drive away many shadows.
quotes.author: St. Francis de Sales

quotes.text: The measure of love is to love without being tired of loving.
quotes.author: St. Francis de Sales

quotes.text: Make friends with the angels, who though invisible are always with you.
quotes.author: St. Francis de Sales

quotes.text: Our Lord loves you and loves you tenderly; and if He does not let you feel the sweetness of His love, it is to make you more humble.
quotes.author: St. Francis de Sales

quotes.text: The greater your imperfections, the more Jesus loves you.
quotes.author: St. Francis de Sales

quotes.text: The Lord's mercy often rides to the door of our hearts upon the black horse of affliction.
quotes.author: St. Francis de Sales

quotes.text: Do not look forward to what might happen tomorrow; the same everlasting Father who cares for you today will take care of you tomorrow and every day.
quotes.author: St. Francis de Sales

quotes.text: Start by doing what's necessary; then do what's possible; and suddenly you are doing the impossible.
quotes.author: St. Francis of Assisi

quotes.text: Lord, make me an instrument of your peace.
quotes.author: St. Francis of Assisi

quotes.text: Where there is charity and wisdom, there is neither fear nor ignorance.
quotes.author: St. Francis of Assisi

quotes.text: All the darkness in the world cannot extinguish the light of a single candle.
quotes.author: St. Francis of Assisi

quotes.text: It is no use walking anywhere to preach unless our walking is our preaching.
quotes.author: St. Francis of Assisi

quotes.text: If God can work through me, He can work through anyone.
quotes.author: St. Francis of Assisi

quotes.text: Remember that when you leave this earth, you can take with you nothing that you have received - only what you have given.
quotes.author: St. Francis of Assisi

quotes.text: A single friar who prays for the people does more service than a hundred religious who have no prayer life.
quotes.author: St. Francis of Assisi

quotes.text: Above all the grace and the gifts that Christ gives to his beloved is that of overcoming self.
quotes.author: St. Francis of Assisi

quotes.text: We have been called to heal wounds, to unite what has fallen apart, and to bring home those who have lost their way.
quotes.author: St. Francis of Assisi

quotes.text: The soul that is attached to anything however much good there may be in it, will not arrive at the liberty of divine union.
quotes.author: St. John of the Cross

quotes.text: If you purify your soul of attachment to and desire for things, you will understand them spiritually.
quotes.author: St. John of the Cross

quotes.text: The more God wants to give us, the more He makes us desire.
quotes.author: St. John of the Cross

quotes.text: The soul that walks in love neither tires others nor grows tired.
quotes.author: St. John of the Cross

quotes.text: What we need most in order to make progress is to be silent before this great God with our appetite and with our tongue, for the language He best hears is silent love.
quotes.author: St. John of the Cross

quotes.text: If you desire to possess Christ, never seek Him without the cross.
quotes.author: St. John of the Cross

quotes.text: The endurance of darkness is the preparation for great light.
quotes.author: St. John of the Cross

quotes.text: Without love, deeds, even the most brilliant, count as nothing.
quotes.author: St. Thérèse of Lisieux

quotes.text: Remember that nothing is small in the eyes of God. Do all that you do with love.
quotes.author: St. Thérèse of Lisieux

quotes.text: The splendor of the rose and the whiteness of the lily do not rob the little violet of its scent nor the daisy of its simple charm.
quotes.author: St. Thérèse of Lisieux

quotes.text: God does not need our good works, but our neighbors do.
quotes.author: St. Thérèse of Lisieux

quotes.text: Love proves itself by deeds, so how am I to show my love? Great deeds are forbidden me. The only way I can prove my love is by scattering flowers and these flowers are every little sacrifice, every glance and word, and the doing of the least actions for love.
quotes.author: St. Thérèse of Lisieux

quotes.text: May today there be peace within. May you trust God that you are exactly where you are meant to be.
quotes.author: St. Thérèse of Lisieux

quotes.text: After my death, I will let fall a shower of roses.
quotes.author: St. Thérèse of Lisieux

quotes.text: Everything is a grace, everything is the direct effect of our Father's love.
quotes.author: St. Thérèse of Lisieux

quotes.text: To love is to give all and to give oneself.
quotes.author: St. Thérèse of Lisieux

quotes.text: It is not what we eat or wear that matters; it is the love we carry in our hearts that makes us beautiful.
quotes.author: St. Mother Teresa

quotes.text: Not all of us can do great things. But we can do small things with great love.
quotes.author: St. Mother Teresa

quotes.text: If you judge people, you have no time to love them.
quotes.author: St. Mother Teresa

quotes.text: Be faithful in small things because it is in them that your strength lies.
quotes.author: St. Mother Teresa

quotes.text: Do not think that love in order to be genuine has to be extraordinary.
quotes.author: St. Mother Teresa

quotes.text: Peace begins with a smile.
quotes.author: St. Mother Teresa

quotes.text: Kind words can be short and easy to speak, but their echoes are truly endless.
quotes.author: St. Mother Teresa

quotes.text: I alone cannot change the world, but I can cast a stone across the waters to create many ripples.
quotes.author: St. Mother Teresa

quotes.text: Let us always meet each other with smile, for the smile is the beginning of love.
quotes.author: St. Mother Teresa

quotes.text: Yesterday is gone. Tomorrow has not yet come. We have only today. Let us begin.
quotes.author: St. Mother Teresa

quotes.text: Spread love everywhere you go. Let no one ever come to you without leaving happier.
quotes.author: St. Mother Teresa

quotes.text: I am a little pencil in the hand of a writing God, who is sending a love letter to the world.
quotes.author: St. Mother Teresa

quotes.text: Do ordinary things with extraordinary love.
quotes.author: St. Mother Teresa

quotes.text: Love begins at home, and it is not how much we do, but how much love we put in that action.
quotes.author: St. Mother Teresa

quotes.text: Intense love does not measure, it just gives.
quotes.author: St. Mother Teresa

quotes.text: If we have no peace, it is because we have forgotten that we belong to each other.
quotes.author: St. Mother Teresa

quotes.text: To keep a lamp burning we have to keep putting oil in it.
quotes.author: St. Mother Teresa

quotes.text: Prayer in action is love, and love in action is service.
quotes.author: St. Mother Teresa

quotes.text: To acquire knowledge, one must study; but to acquire wisdom, one must observe.
quotes.author: St. Thomas Aquinas

quotes.text: Three things are necessary for the salvation of man: to know what he ought to believe; to know what he ought to desire; and to know what he ought to do.
quotes.author: St. Thomas Aquinas

quotes.text: Sorrow can be alleviated by good sleep, a bath and a glass of wine.
quotes.author: St. Thomas Aquinas

quotes.text: Better to illuminate than merely to shine; to deliver to others contemplated truths than merely to contemplate.
quotes.author: St. Thomas Aquinas

quotes.text: Beware of the person of one book.
quotes.author: St. Thomas Aquinas

quotes.text: If the highest aim of a captain were to preserve his ship, he would keep it in port forever.
quotes.author: St. Thomas Aquinas

quotes.text: Sanctify yourself and you will sanctify society.
quotes.author: St. Francis of Assisi

quotes.text: Act as if everything depended on you; trust as if everything depended on God.
quotes.author: St. Ignatius of Loyola

quotes.text: Pray as if everything depended on God. Work as if everything depended on you.
quotes.author: St. Ignatius of Loyola

quotes.text: For those who love, nothing is too difficult, especially when it is done for the love of our Lord Jesus Christ.
quotes.author: St. Ignatius of Loyola

quotes.text: Few souls understand what God would accomplish in them if they were to abandon themselves unreservedly to Him.
quotes.author: St. Ignatius of Loyola

quotes.text: Lord, teach me to be generous. Teach me to serve you as you deserve; to give and not to count the cost.
quotes.author: St. Ignatius of Loyola

quotes.text: The safest and most suitable form of penance seems to be that which causes pain in the flesh but does not penetrate to the bones, that is, which causes suffering but not sickness.
quotes.author: St. Ignatius of Loyola

quotes.text: In all things, look to the end.
quotes.author: St. Ignatius of Loyola

quotes.text: He who goes about to reform the world must begin with himself, or he loses his labor.
quotes.author: St. Ignatius of Loyola

quotes.text: Be careful then how you live, not as unwise people but as wise, making the most of the time, because the days are evil.
quotes.author: Ephesians 5:15-16

quotes.text: Love is shown more in deeds than in words.
quotes.author: St. Ignatius of Loyola

quotes.text: Where Peter is, there is the Church; and where the Church is, there is no death, but life eternal.
quotes.author: St. Ambrose

quotes.text: God freely created us so that we might know, love, and serve him in this life and be happy with him forever.
quotes.author: St. Ignatius of Loyola

quotes.text: All for the greater glory of God.
quotes.author: St. Ignatius of Loyola

quotes.text: In time of desolation, never make a change.
quotes.author: St. Ignatius of Loyola

quotes.text: If God causes you to suffer much, it is a sign that He has great designs for you and that He certainly intends to make you a saint.
quotes.author: St. Ignatius of Loyola

quotes.text: Happy are those who die in the Lord.
quotes.author: Revelation 14:13

quotes.text: The world promises you comfort, but you were not made for comfort. You were made for greatness.
quotes.author: Pope Benedict XVI

quotes.text: Being Christian is not the result of an ethical choice or a lofty idea, but the encounter with an event, a person, which gives life a new horizon and a decisive direction.
quotes.author: Pope Benedict XVI

quotes.text: The only really effective apologia for Christianity comes down to two arguments, namely, the saints the Church has produced and the art which has grown in her womb.
quotes.author: Pope Benedict XVI

quotes.text: In the saints we see the victory of love over selfishness and over death.
quotes.author: Pope Benedict XVI

quotes.text: Love alone is credible.
quotes.author: Hans Urs von Balthasar

quotes.text: Prayer is a surge of the heart; it is a simple look turned toward heaven, it is a cry of recognition and of love, embracing both trial and joy.
quotes.author: St. Thérèse of Lisieux

quotes.text: The greatest science is that of saving souls.
quotes.author: St. Alphonsus Liguori

quotes.text: Acquire the spirit of peace and thousands around you will be saved.
quotes.author: St. Seraphim of Sarov

quotes.text: The place of the Christian is on the front lines.
quotes.author: Pope Francis

quotes.text: We are not the sum of our weaknesses and failures; we are the sum of the Father's love for us.
quotes.author: Pope St. John Paul II

quotes.text: Do not abandon yourselves to despair. We are the Easter people and hallelujah is our song.
quotes.author: Pope St. John Paul II

quotes.text: As the family goes, so goes the nation and so goes the whole world in which we live.
quotes.author: Pope St. John Paul II

quotes.text: Freedom consists not in doing what we like, but in having the right to do what we ought.
quotes.author: Pope St. John Paul II

quotes.text: Love is never defeated, and I could add, the history of Ireland proves it.
quotes.author: Pope St. John Paul II

quotes.text: Life is entrusted to man as a treasure which must not be squandered, as a talent which must be used well.
quotes.author: Pope St. John Paul II

quotes.text: The cross is the school of love.
quotes.author: Pope St. John Paul II

quotes.text: Have no fear of moving into the unknown. Simply step out fearlessly knowing that I am with you.
quotes.author: Pope St. John Paul II

quotes.text: The worst prison would be a closed heart.
quotes.author: Pope St. John Paul II

quotes.text: Love is the only light which can constantly illuminate a world grown dim.
quotes.author: Pope St. John Paul II

quotes.text: It is Jesus that you seek when you dream of happiness.
quotes.author: Pope St. John Paul II

quotes.text: The church must breathe with her two lungs: the East and the West.
quotes.author: Pope St. John Paul II

quotes.text: To maintain a joyful family requires much from both the parents and the children. Each member of the family has to become, in a special way, the servant of the others.
quotes.author: Pope St. John Paul II

quotes.text: We must meet real challenges in a spirit of dialogue, and in the sincere conviction that, despite the conflicts and tensions in our world, we are all God's children, members of the one human family.
quotes.author: Pope St. John Paul II

quotes.text: In God's plan, every person is called to promote his own development, and this includes the use of economic goods.
quotes.author: Pope St. John Paul II

quotes.text: Science can purify religion from error and superstition. Religion can purify science from idolatry and false absolutes.
quotes.author: Pope St. John Paul II

quotes.text: There is no place for selfishness and no place for fear! Do not be afraid, then, when love makes demands. Do not be afraid when love requires sacrifice.
quotes.author: Pope St. John Paul II

quotes.text: Prayer is the best weapon we have; it is the key to God's heart.
quotes.author: St. Padre Pio

quotes.text: It is easier for the earth to exist without the sun than without the Holy Sacrifice of the Mass.
quotes.author: St. Padre Pio

quotes.text: Love the Madonna and pray the Rosary, for her Rosary is the weapon against the evils of the world today.
quotes.author: St. Padre Pio

quotes.text: In books we seek God; in prayer we find him.
quotes.author: St. Padre Pio

quotes.text: It would be easier for the world to survive without the sun than to do so without the Holy Mass.
quotes.author: St. Padre Pio

quotes.text: Always stay close to this heavenly Mother, because she is the sea to be crossed to reach the shores of eternal splendor.
quotes.author: St. Padre Pio

quotes.text: When you are in a fix, when you have troubles, when you are having difficulties, turn to your Guardian Angel.
quotes.author: St. Padre Pio

quotes.text: Through the study of books one seeks God; by meditation one finds him.
quotes.author: St. Padre Pio

quotes.text: Humility and purity are the wings which carry us to God and make us almost divine.
quotes.author: St. Padre Pio

quotes.text: The devil is like a rabid dog tied to a chain; beyond the length of the chain he cannot seize anyone. Keep your distance. If you approach too near, you let yourself be caught.
quotes.author: St. Padre Pio

quotes.text: Temptations, when we meet them at first, are as the lion that roared at Samson; but if we overcome them, the next time we see them we shall find a nest of honey within them.
quotes.author: St. John Vianney

quotes.text: The sins of the world are great, but they will never prevail over my mercy.
quotes.author: St. Faustina Kowalska

quotes.text: Jesus, I trust in You.
quotes.author: St. Faustina Kowalska

quotes.text: Let no soul fear to draw near to Me, even though its sins be as scarlet.
quotes.author: Jesus to St. Faustina Kowalska

quotes.text: In the Old Covenant I sent prophets wielding thunderbolts to My people. Today I am sending you with My mercy to the people of the whole world.
quotes.author: Jesus to St. Faustina Kowalska

quotes.text: The graces of My mercy are drawn by means of one vessel only, and that is trust.
quotes.author: Jesus to St. Faustina Kowalska

quotes.text: Souls perish in spite of My bitter Passion. I am giving them the last hope of salvation; that is, the Feast of My Mercy.
quotes.author: Jesus to St. Faustina Kowalska

quotes.text: I desire that the whole world know My infinite mercy. I desire to grant unimaginable graces to those souls who trust in My mercy.
quotes.author: Jesus to St. Faustina Kowalska

quotes.text: The soul that will go to confession and receive Holy Communion shall obtain complete forgiveness of sins and punishment.
quotes.author: Jesus to St. Faustina Kowalska

quotes.text: O my Jesus, You yourself must help me in everything, because You see how very little I am.
quotes.author: St. Faustina Kowalska

quotes.text: Without suffering, prayer lacks power.
quotes.author: St. Faustina Kowalska

quotes.text: Silence is so powerful a language that it reaches the throne of the living God.
quotes.author: St. Faustina Kowalska

quotes.text: I demand from you deeds of mercy, which are to arise out of love for Me.
quotes.author: Jesus to St. Faustina Kowalska

quotes.text: A soul does not benefit as much from other spiritual exercises as it does from mercy.
quotes.author: St. Faustina Kowalska

quotes.text: O Blood and Water, which gushed forth from the Heart of Jesus as a fountain of Mercy for us, I trust in You!
quotes.author: St. Faustina Kowalska

quotes.text: The true conquest is that of the kingdom within.
quotes.author: St. Catherine of Siena

quotes.text: Nothing great is ever achieved without much enduring.
quotes.author: St. Catherine of Siena

quotes.text: Preach the Truth as if you had a million voices. It is silence that kills the world.
quotes.author: St. Catherine of Siena

quotes.text: Start being brave about everything. Drive out darkness and spread light. Don't look at your weaknesses. Realize instead that in Christ crucified you can do everything.
quotes.author: St. Catherine of Siena

quotes.text: Proclaim the truth and do not be silent through fear.
quotes.author: St. Catherine of Siena

quotes.text: We've had enough exhortations to be silent. Cry out with a hundred thousand tongues. I see the world is rotten because of silence.
quotes.author: St. Catherine of Siena

quotes.text: Build a cell inside your mind, from which you can never flee.
quotes.author: St. Catherine of Siena

quotes.text: Do not be satisfied with little things, because God wants great things!
quotes.author: St. Catherine of Siena

quotes.text: The devil fears hearts on fire with love of God.
quotes.author: St. Catherine of Siena

quotes.text: All God's creatures are His family; and he is more generous to the bad ones than the good ones, because divinity is nothing but supreme generosity.
quotes.author: St. Catherine of Siena

quotes.text: The road to heaven is crucified; follow the way.
quotes.author: St. Catherine of Siena

quotes.text: It is no sin to fight for the right king.
quotes.author: St. Joan of Arc

quotes.text: I am not afraid. I was born to do this.
quotes.author: St. Joan of Arc

quotes.text: Act, and God will act.
quotes.author: St. Joan of Arc

quotes.text: I would rather die than do something which I know to be a sin.
quotes.author: St. Joan of Arc

quotes.text: Children say that people are hung sometimes for speaking the truth.
quotes.author: St. Joan of Arc

quotes.text: All battles are first won or lost, in the mind.
quotes.author: St. Joan of Arc

quotes.text: Get up tomorrow early in the morning, and earlier than you did today, and do the best that you can.
quotes.author: St. Joan of Arc

quotes.text: Hold the cross high so I may see it through the flames!
quotes.author: St. Joan of Arc

quotes.text: About Jesus Christ and the Church, I simply know they're just one thing, and we shouldn't complicate the matter.
quotes.author: St. Joan of Arc

quotes.text: Every man gives his life for what he believes. Sometimes people believe in little or nothing, and so they give their lives to little or nothing.
quotes.author: St. Joan of Arc

quotes.text: One life is all we have and we live it as we believe in living it.
quotes.author: St. Joan of Arc

quotes.text: Help yourself and God will help you.
quotes.author: St. Joan of Arc

quotes.text: All things are possible to one who believes, yet more to one who hopes, more still to one who loves, and most of all to one who practices and perseveres in these three virtues.
quotes.author: St. Lawrence of Brindisi

quotes.text: If you love, you will suffer, and if you do not love, you do not know the meaning of a Christian life.
quotes.author: St. Agatha

quotes.text: You must know that when you find it difficult to get to God, because of the multitude of your sins, Mary, who is the Mother of Mercy, is there with her mercy, ready to help you.
quotes.author: St. Louis de Montfort

quotes.text: True devotion to Mary is interior, tender, holy, constant, and disinterested.
quotes.author: St. Louis de Montfort

quotes.text: To Jesus through Mary.
quotes.author: St. Louis de Montfort

quotes.text: God alone!
quotes.author: St. Louis de Montfort

quotes.text: The greatest honor we can give to God is to live gladly because of the knowledge of His love.
quotes.author: St. Julian of Norwich

quotes.text: All shall be well, and all shall be well, and all manner of things shall be well.
quotes.author: St. Julian of Norwich

quotes.text: He said not 'Thou shalt not be troubled, thou shalt not be belabored, thou shalt not be afflicted'; but he said, 'Thou shalt not be overcome.'
quotes.author: St. Julian of Norwich

quotes.text: The fullness of joy is to behold God in everything.
quotes.author: St. Julian of Norwich

quotes.text: God is nearer to us than our own soul.
quotes.author: St. Julian of Norwich

quotes.text: Prayer unites the soul to God.
quotes.author: St. Julian of Norwich

quotes.text: Love was his meaning.
quotes.author: St. Julian of Norwich

quotes.text: God did not say: You shall not be tempest-tossed, you shall not be work-weary, you shall not be discomforted. But he said: You shall not be overcome.
quotes.author: St. Julian of Norwich

quotes.text: Pray inwardly, even if you do not enjoy it. It does good, though you feel nothing. Yes, even though you think you are doing nothing.
quotes.author: St. Julian of Norwich

quotes.text: In His love He clothes us, enfolds and embraces us; that tender love completely surrounds us, never to leave us.
quotes.author: St. Julian of Norwich

quotes.text: God has created me to do Him some definite service. He has committed some work to me which He has not committed to another.
quotes.author: St. John Henry Newman

quotes.text: Lead, kindly Light, amid the encircling gloom, lead Thou me on; the night is dark, and I am far from home.
quotes.author: St. John Henry Newman

quotes.text: Fear not that your life shall come to an end, but rather that it shall never have a beginning.
quotes.author: St. John Henry Newman

quotes.text: The Christian has a deep, silent, hidden peace, which the world sees not.
quotes.author: St. John Henry Newman

quotes.text: Growth is the only evidence of life.
quotes.author: St. John Henry Newman

quotes.text: Find work you love and you will never have to work a day in your life.
quotes.author: St. Josemaría Escrivá

quotes.text: Obedience is the virtue that perfects all other virtues.
quotes.author: St. Josemaría Escrivá

quotes.text: Holiness is not reserved for a small number of exceptional persons. All of us are called to be holy.
quotes.author: St. Josemaría Escrivá

quotes.text: Be convinced that nothing happens by chance. Everything has been lovingly planned by God.
quotes.author: St. Josemaría Escrivá

quotes.text: Don't let your life be sterile. Be useful. Make yourself felt. Shine forth with the torch of your faith and your love.
quotes.author: St. Josemaría Escrivá

quotes.text: The science of the Cross can be learned only from severe trials and great suffering.
quotes.author: St. Edith Stein

quotes.text: Do not accept anything as the truth if it lacks love. And do not accept anything as love which lacks truth!
quotes.author: St. Edith Stein

quotes.text: The nation doesn't simply need what we have. It needs what we are.
quotes.author: St. Edith Stein

quotes.text: One cannot desire freedom from the Cross when one is especially chosen for the Cross.
quotes.author: St. Edith Stein

quotes.text: The limitless possibilities of our relationship with God can be realized only when we move beyond our feelings.
quotes.author: St. Edith Stein

quotes.text: To be a child of God means to be led by the hand through the darkness by Another.
quotes.author: Blessed Titus Brandsma

quotes.text: Those who want to win the world for Christ must have the courage to come into conflict with it.
quotes.author: Blessed Titus Brandsma

quotes.text: The way to love anything is to realize that it may be lost.
quotes.author: G.K. Chesterton

quotes.text: The Christian ideal has not been tried and found wanting. It has been found difficult and left untried.
quotes.author: G.K. Chesterton

quotes.text: A dead thing can go with the stream, but only a living thing can go against it.
quotes.author: G.K. Chesterton

quotes.text: The Bible tells us to love our neighbors, and also to love our enemies; probably because generally they are the same people.
quotes.author: G.K. Chesterton

quotes.text: A saint is one who exaggerates what the world neglects.
quotes.author: G.K. Chesterton

quotes.text: Anything worth doing is worth doing badly.
quotes.author: G.K. Chesterton

quotes.text: The true soldier fights not because he hates what is in front of him, but because he loves what is behind him.
quotes.author: G.K. Chesterton

quotes.text: Angels can fly because they take themselves lightly.
quotes.author: G.K. Chesterton

quotes.text: The knowledge of God is the cause of things, for the knowledge of God is to all creatures what the knowledge of the artificer is to things made by his art.
quotes.author: St. Thomas Aquinas

quotes.text: How can we live in harmony? First we need to know we are all madly in love with the same God.
quotes.author: St. Thomas Aquinas

quotes.text: Love takes up where knowledge leaves off.
quotes.author: St. Thomas Aquinas

quotes.text: Wonder is the desire for knowledge.
quotes.author: St. Thomas Aquinas

quotes.text: Grant me, O Lord my God, a mind to know you, a heart to seek you, wisdom to find you, conduct pleasing to you, faithful perseverance in waiting for you, and a hope of finally embracing you.
quotes.author: St. Thomas Aquinas

quotes.text: To convert somebody go and take them by the hand and guide them.
quotes.author: St. Thomas Aquinas

quotes.text: Faith has to do with things that are not seen and hope with things that are not at hand.
quotes.author: St. Thomas Aquinas

quotes.text: Well-ordered self-love is right and natural.
quotes.author: St. Thomas Aquinas

quotes.text: We are like children, who stand in need of masters to enlighten us and direct us; and God has provided for this, by appointing his angels to be our teachers and guides.
quotes.author: St. Thomas Aquinas

quotes.text: The perfection of charity is that by which we love God with our whole heart.
quotes.author: St. Thomas Aquinas

quotes.text: Grace is nothing else than a certain beginning of glory in us.
quotes.author: St. Thomas Aquinas

quotes.text: Jesus Christ became man so that we might become God.
quotes.author: St. Athanasius

quotes.text: You cannot put straight in others what is warped in yourself.
quotes.author: St. Athanasius

quotes.text: For the Son of God became man so that we might become God.
quotes.author: St. Athanasius

quotes.text: Death came through sin, but by the Incarnation of the Word, death has been destroyed and life raised up anew.
quotes.author: St. Athanasius

quotes.text: God became man so that man might become god.
quotes.author: St. Athanasius

quotes.text: The devil is afraid of us when we pray and make sacrifices. He is also afraid when we are humble and good. He is especially afraid when we love Jesus very much.
quotes.author: St. Anthony of Padua

quotes.text: Earthly riches are like the reed. Its roots are sunk in the swamp, and its exterior is fair to behold; but inside it is hollow. If a man leans on such a reed, it will snap off and pierce his soul.
quotes.author: St. Anthony of Padua

quotes.text: The life of the body is the soul; the life of the soul is God.
quotes.author: St. Anthony of Padua

quotes.text: O wonderful, O sweet exchange! The Creator of mankind, assuming a living body, deigned to be born of the Virgin, and becoming man without man's concurrence, bestowed on us His Divinity.
quotes.author: St. Anthony of Padua

quotes.text: The saints are like the stars. In his providence Christ conceals them in a hidden place that they may not shine before others when they might wish to do so.
quotes.author: St. Anthony of Padua

quotes.text: Let us ask the Lord to give us the grace to hate sin as He hates it; to be sorry for our sins with something of the sorrow with which He bears them.
quotes.author: St. Anthony of Padua

quotes.text: Attribute to God every good that you have received. If you take credit for something that does not belong to you, you will be guilty of theft.
quotes.author: St. Anthony of Padua

quotes.text: The purest suffering bears and carries in its train the purest understanding.
quotes.author: St. John of the Cross

quotes.text: Live in the world as if only God and your soul were in it; then your heart will never be made captive by any earthly thing.
quotes.author: St. John of the Cross

quotes.text: Have a great love for those who contradict and fail to love you, for in this way love is begotten in a heart that has no love.
quotes.author: St. John of the Cross

quotes.text: Oh, night that guided me, Oh, night more lovely than the dawn, Oh, night that joined Beloved with lover, Lover transformed in the Beloved!
quotes.author: St. John of the Cross

quotes.text: The soul needs not speak, but only to suffer itself to be loved.
quotes.author: St. John of the Cross

quotes.text: God desires the least degree of purity of conscience in you more than all the works you can perform.
quotes.author: St. John of the Cross

quotes.text: Strive always to confess your sins with a deep knowledge of your own wretchedness and with clarity and purity.
quotes.author: St. John of the Cross

quotes.text: To reach satisfaction in all, desire its possession in nothing.
quotes.author: St. John of the Cross

quotes.text: If a man wishes to be sure of the road he treads on, he must close his eyes and walk in the dark.
quotes.author: St. John of the Cross

quotes.text: The virtues are never perfectly ours until they cost us some suffering.
quotes.author: St. John of the Cross

quotes.text: Launch out into the deep and you shall see.
quotes.author: St. John of the Cross

quotes.text: The more you seek God, the more you will find Him; and the more you find Him, the more you will love Him.
quotes.author: St. John of the Cross

quotes.text: He who seeks not the cross of Christ seeks not the glory of Christ.
quotes.author: St. John of the Cross

quotes.text: The humble knowledge of yourself is a surer way to God than the deepest search after science.
quotes.author: Thomas à Kempis

quotes.text: Man sees your actions, but God your intentions.
quotes.author: Thomas à Kempis

quotes.text: The greatest saint in the world is not he who prays most or fasts most; it is not he who gives alms, or is most eminent for temperance, chastity or justice. It is he who is most thankful to God.
quotes.author: Thomas à Kempis

quotes.text: First keep the peace within yourself, then you can also bring peace to others.
quotes.author: Thomas à Kempis

quotes.text: Be not angry that you cannot make others as you wish them to be, since you cannot make yourself as you wish to be.
quotes.author: Thomas à Kempis

quotes.text: Without the way, there is no going; without the truth, there is no knowing; without the life, there is no living.
quotes.author: Thomas à Kempis

quotes.text: If your heart is pure, then all things in your world are pure.
quotes.author: Thomas à Kempis

quotes.text: At the Day of Judgment, we shall not be asked what we have read, but what we have done.
quotes.author: Thomas à Kempis

quotes.text: Wherever you are, whatever you do, seek always to find God.
quotes.author: Thomas à Kempis

quotes.text: What do you desire, love, or fear but the changeable things of time?
quotes.author: Thomas à Kempis

quotes.text: If you wish to know and appreciate something, try to obtain this thing by your own efforts.
quotes.author: Thomas à Kempis

quotes.text: Never be entirely idle; but either be reading, or writing, or praying or meditating or endeavoring something for the public good.
quotes.author: Thomas à Kempis

quotes.text: What is there in life that can give you greater content than to work for the Kingdom of God?
quotes.author: Thomas à Kempis

quotes.text: A pure heart and good conscience will give you boldness in the presence of God.
quotes.author: Thomas à Kempis

quotes.text: Who is braver: the man with a thousand men at his side, or he who faces a thousand alone?
quotes.author: St. Columba

quotes.text: Christ is my Druid.
quotes.author: St. Columba

quotes.text: I see the secret way things are.
quotes.author: St. Columba

quotes.text: Alone with none but Thee, my God, I journey on my way.
quotes.author: St. Columba

quotes.text: Never give a hollow greeting to a friend, or pay a hollow compliment.
quotes.author: St. Columba

quotes.text: Make holy these gifts, we pray, and let us who celebrate this sacrifice turn away from our sinful ways.
quotes.author: Ancient Celtic Prayer

quotes.text: Let me seek You in longing, let me long for You in seeking; let me find You in love, and love You in finding.
quotes.author: St. Anselm

quotes.text: God is that, the greater than which cannot be conceived.
quotes.author: St. Anselm

quotes.text: For I do not seek to understand so that I may believe; but I believe so that I may understand.
quotes.author: St. Anselm

quotes.text: The prayers and tears of God's people are never lost, for God treasures both, and they never fail to have their effect in his time and his way.
quotes.author: St. Anselm

quotes.text: We believe by loving.
quotes.author: St. Anselm

quotes.text: O Lord my God, teach my heart where and how to seek You, where and how to find You.
quotes.author: St. Anselm

quotes.text: The knowledge of God is the cause of things.
quotes.author: St. Anselm

quotes.text: I have no hope but in Thy great mercy.
quotes.author: St. Anselm

quotes.text: God often delays the answer to our prayers, because He wants us to ask again and again, and to seek Him with all our hearts.
quotes.author: St. Anselm

quotes.text: That than which nothing greater can be thought cannot be in the mind alone.
quotes.author: St. Anselm

quotes.text: You have created us for Yourself, and our heart cannot be stilled until it finds rest in You.
quotes.author: St. Anselm

quotes.text: The Devil is a liar. He will lie to confuse us; but he will also mix lies with the truth to attack us.
quotes.author: St. Columba

quotes.text: Nothing is more powerful than the humble, simple prayer of a faithful Christian.
quotes.author: St. John Chrysostom

quotes.text: Prayer is the place of refuge for every worry, a foundation for cheerfulness, a source of constant happiness, a protection against sadness.
quotes.author: St. John Chrysostom

quotes.text: The road to heaven is narrow but joyful and easy for those who walk it.
quotes.author: St. John Chrysostom

quotes.text: When you are before the altar and distributing Holy Communion, you stand as if in heaven itself.
quotes.author: St. John Chrysostom

quotes.text: Let us show Him the wounds which we received in His service and He will show us the scars which He bears for us.
quotes.author: St. John Chrysostom

quotes.text: No act of virtue can be great if it is not followed by advantage for others. So, no matter how much time you spend fasting, no matter how much you sleep on a hard floor and eat ashes and sigh continually, if you do no good to others, you do nothing great.
quotes.author: St. John Chrysostom

quotes.text: God allows us to experience the low points of life in order to teach us lessons that we could learn in no other way.
quotes.author: C.S. Lewis

quotes.text: A man can no more diminish God's glory by refusing to worship Him than a lunatic can put out the sun by scribbling the word 'darkness' on the walls of his cell.
quotes.author: C.S. Lewis

quotes.text: I believe in Christianity as I believe that the sun has risen: not only because I see it, but because by it I see everything else.
quotes.author: C.S. Lewis

quotes.text: Humility is not thinking less of yourself, it's thinking of yourself less.
quotes.author: C.S. Lewis

quotes.text: You are never too old to set another goal or to dream a new dream.
quotes.author: C.S. Lewis

quotes.text: Hardships often prepare ordinary people for an extraordinary destiny.
quotes.author: C.S. Lewis

quotes.text: The task of the modern educator is not to cut down jungles, but to irrigate deserts.
quotes.author: C.S. Lewis

quotes.text: You can't go back and change the beginning, but you can start where you are and change the ending.
quotes.author: C.S. Lewis

quotes.text: Courage is not simply one of the virtues, but the form of every virtue at the testing point.
quotes.author: C.S. Lewis

quotes.text: If you read history you will find that the Christians who did most for the present world were precisely those who thought most of the next.
quotes.author: C.S. Lewis

quotes.text: What draws people to be friends is that they see the same truth. They share it.
quotes.author: C.S. Lewis

quotes.text: If we really think that home is elsewhere and that this life is a wandering to find home, why should we not look forward to the arrival?
quotes.author: C.S. Lewis

quotes.text: Love is not affectionate feeling, but a steady wish for the loved person's ultimate good as far as it can be obtained.
quotes.author: C.S. Lewis

quotes.text: Aim at heaven and you will get earth thrown in. Aim at earth and you get neither.
quotes.author: C.S. Lewis

quotes.text: God cannot give us a happiness and peace apart from Himself, because it is not there. There is no such thing.
quotes.author: C.S. Lewis

quotes.text: We must lay before Him what is in us, not what ought to be in us.
quotes.author: C.S. Lewis

quotes.text: The Christian does not think God will love us because we are good, but that God will make us good because He loves us.
quotes.author: C.S. Lewis

quotes.text: Relying on God has to begin all over again every day as if nothing had yet been done.
quotes.author: C.S. Lewis

quotes.text: The door on which we have been knocking all our lives will open at last.
quotes.author: C.S. Lewis

quotes.text: The only people who achieve much are those who want knowledge so badly that they seek it while the conditions are still unfavorable.
quotes.author: C.S. Lewis

quotes.text: God whispers to us in our pleasures, speaks in our conscience, but shouts in our pains: it is His megaphone to rouse a deaf world.
quotes.author: C.S. Lewis

quotes.text: Every time we make a choice we are turning the central part of us into something a little different from what it was before.
quotes.author: Venerable Fulton J. Sheen

quotes.text: There are not one hundred people in the United States who hate The Catholic Church, but there are millions who hate what they wrongly perceive the Catholic Church to be.
quotes.author: Venerable Fulton J. Sheen

quotes.text: You must remember to love people and use things, rather than to love things and use people.
quotes.author: Venerable Fulton J. Sheen

quotes.text: Hearing Mass is the ceremony I most favor during my travels. Church is the only place where someone speaks to me and I do not have to answer back.
quotes.author: Venerable Fulton J. Sheen

quotes.text: Once you have surrendered yourself, you make yourself receptive. In receiving from God, you are perfected and completed.
quotes.author: Venerable Fulton J. Sheen

quotes.text: Moral principles do not depend on a majority vote. Wrong is wrong, even if everybody is wrong. Right is right, even if nobody is right.
quotes.author: Venerable Fulton J. Sheen

quotes.text: Pride is an admission of weakness; it secretly fears all competition and dreads all rivals.
quotes.author: Venerable Fulton J. Sheen

quotes.text: The proud man counts his newspaper clippings, the humble man his blessings.
quotes.author: Venerable Fulton J. Sheen

quotes.text: If you do not worship God, you worship something, and nine times out of ten it will be yourself.
quotes.author: Venerable Fulton J. Sheen

quotes.text: The refusal to take sides on great moral issues is itself a decision. It is a silent acquiescence to evil.
quotes.author: Venerable Fulton J. Sheen

quotes.text: Patience is power. Patience is not an absence of action; rather it is timing. It waits on the right time to act, for the right principles and in the right way.
quotes.author: Venerable Fulton J. Sheen

quotes.text: The big challenge of life is to decide what is important and to disregard everything else.
quotes.author: Venerable Fulton J. Sheen

quotes.text: Love is a mutual self-giving which ends in self-recovery.
quotes.author: Venerable Fulton J. Sheen

quotes.text: When a man loves a woman, he has to become worthy of her. The higher her virtue, the more noble her character, the more devoted she is to truth, justice, goodness, the more a man has to aspire to be worthy of her.
quotes.author: Venerable Fulton J. Sheen

quotes.text: Unless there is a Good Friday in your life, there can be no Easter Sunday.
quotes.author: Venerable Fulton J. Sheen

quotes.text: Jealousy is the tribute that mediocrity pays to genius.
quotes.author: Venerable Fulton J. Sheen

quotes.text: The way to find out if you really love God is to be delighted when someone else is preferred over you.
quotes.author: Venerable Fulton J. Sheen

quotes.text: If He who was without sin prayed, how much more ought sinners to pray?
quotes.author: St. Cyprian

quotes.text: Shake the dust from your feet.
quotes.author: Matthew 10:14
